chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: In this class, we are going to learn about Operators in Java.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Now, if we want to write an expression in Maths, how do we write it?

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: For example, we have written sum is equal to a plus b.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will call this an expression in Maths and in fact in Java.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: There are 2-3 components of an expression whose names we should know.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: For example, we call a and b as Operands and plus as Operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Whenever an operation is performed, it has 2 major components.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The first one is Operands, i.e. who did we add, subtract, multiply, etc.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Operands are a and b.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The second major component of an expression is Operator.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Operator is the symbol that tells us which operation is being performed.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Here, since addition operation is being performed, so plus sign is the operator.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We could have written difference as a minus b.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Here, a and b are Operands and minus sign is the operator.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Operators are similar to Maths operators in Java.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Operators are the symbols in Java that tell the compiler which operation should be performed.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: For example, plus tells the compiler that we should add.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Here, a minus b tells the compiler that we should subtract.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Here, a multiplied by b tells us that we should multiply.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Here, a divided by b tells us that we should divide.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: In this way, there are many operators in Java.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: In fact, to summarize, there are many types of operators in Java.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The first type is Arithmetic operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: These have their own subtypes, Binary and Unary.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: There is another type, Ternary.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will be studying this in the next section, i.e. with conditional statements.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The second type is Relational operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The third type is Logical operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: The fourth type is Bitwise operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will be studying these operators in the Bit manipulation section.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: These will be a little high level for now.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will cover all these stories in the Bit manipulation section.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: Other than that, there are Assignment operators.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will be studying all these operators in this class.

chunks.title: Operation
chunks.text: We will study each one of them, understand their meaning, look at the examples and write a lot of code.

text: In this class, we are going to learn about Operators in Java. Now, if we want to write an expression in Maths, how do we write it? For example, we have written sum is equal to a plus b. We will call this an expression in Maths and in fact in Java. There are 2-3 components of an expression whose names we should know. For example, we call a and b as Operands and plus as Operators. Whenever an operation is performed, it has 2 major components. The first one is Operands, i.e. who did we add, subtract, multiply, etc. Operands are a and b. The second major component of an expression is Operator. Operator is the symbol that tells us which operation is being performed. Here, since addition operation is being performed, so plus sign is the operator. We could have written difference as a minus b. Here, a and b are Operands and minus sign is the operator. Operators are similar to Maths operators in Java. Operators are the symbols in Java that tell the compiler which operation should be performed. For example, plus tells the compiler that we should add. Here, a minus b tells the compiler that we should subtract. Here, a multiplied by b tells us that we should multiply. Here, a divided by b tells us that we should divide. In this way, there are many operators in Java. In fact, to summarize, there are many types of operators in Java. The first type is Arithmetic operators. These have their own subtypes, Binary and Unary. There is another type, Ternary. We will be studying this in the next section, i.e. with conditional statements. The second type is Relational operators. The third type is Logical operators. The fourth type is Bitwise operators. We will be studying these operators in the Bit manipulation section. These will be a little high level for now. We will cover all these stories in the Bit manipulation section. Other than that, there are Assignment operators. We will be studying all these operators in this class. We will study each one of them, understand their meaning, look at the examples and write a lot of code.
